title: Two ants of length 1cm and 1.2 cm crawl in opposite directions with average speeds 2 and 1 mm per second respectively. How many seconds will they take to cross each other? - Quora

response.answer_text: Relative speed of ants = (2+1) = 3 mm/s. = 0.3 cm/s. Crossing time = distance/relative speed. = (1+1.2) cm/(0.3 cm/s). = (22/3).seconds. = 7.33 seconds. Answer.
Relative speed=2+1=3 mm/sec distance to cross= 1+1.2=2.2 cm=22 mm Time=distance/speed= 22/3= 7.3333…sec
